trends: There have been 41 other sightings in El Cajon
There were no other sightings in El Cajon on or around July 28th 2003
divs: Sighting DetailsI,Bud Harper was sitting outside,in front yard when I noticed what I thought wasa falling star brighter than usual.The object seemed to be falling from right toleft at aprox.40 to 45 deg.As it fell I said to my wife look,look,and as sheturned to look the object seemed slow just a bit and make a noticible roundedturn to the right and proceeded to fall in E.S.E direction and at a less steepor flatter angle,aprox.12 to 15 deg.My Wife didnt have time to see it.By thetime I told her to look 3 seconds had elapsed and it turned sped off was another2 seconds. It was only slightly overcast as I could see some of the brighteststars. Addtionally on 7-29-2003 at aprox. 2330 hours Witness 2 and I were againsitting out front,and this time He says for me to look.As I turned I didnt seeanything. So he describes a very similar occurance as the night before,andwithin no more than 30 seconds he yells there it is again and I turn to see thelight speeding off to a N.E.direction.This second sighting on the second nightby me was aprox.80 to 90 deg.to my left at aprox.1000 O-CLOCK posistion.AsWitness 2 describes second sighting , He says object appeared to make a almostcomplete circle. We concurred that had the lightjudging by its size andbrightnessbeen regular aircraft weed have heard noise,and the speed We witnesseddidnt seem possible at all.
Summary: East San Diego County Night Sightings
